current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require certain agencies to conduct assessments of data centers and develop data center
			 consolidation and optimization plans.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Federal Data Center Consolidation Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Data Center Consolidation Act of 2013

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Data Center Consolidation Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b/p:4/sp:A

header.#text:
Ensuring
		cybersecurity standards for data center consolidation and cloud
		computing

text.#text:
In implementing a data center consolidation and optimization strategy under this Act, a covered
			 agency shall do so in a manner that is consistent with Federal
		guidelines on cloud computing security, including—

applicable
		provisions found within the Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program
		(FedRAMP); and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Institute of Standards and Technology

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to update or modify the Federal guidelines on cloud
			 computing security.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Office of
			 Management and Budget

text.#text: Nothing in this Act shall be construed to limit the ability of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or their respective designee,
			 may waive the applicability to any national security system, as defined in

, of any provision of this Act
			 if the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or
			 their respective designee, determines that such waiver is in the interest
			 of national security. Not later than 30 days after making a waiver under
			 this subsection, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or their respective designee, shall submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on
			 Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

Select Committee on
			 Intelligence of the Senate

Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a statement describing the waiver and the reasons for the
			 waiver.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence of the House of
			 Representatives

text.#text:
This Act is repealed effective on
		October 1, 2018.
